results.title: Quiet crisis
results.brief_description: A dramatised story of a typical cancer case. This film is a plea for an early visit to the doctor by anyone having the slightest suspicion of the disease. Shows that with early treatment by improved methods, cancer may often be cured while delay can prove to be fatal. Note: This film had been viewed by medical experts and it is considered that the treatment portrayed in the film is not in accord with actual treatment as available in Victoria.

results.title: Quick rise
results.brief_description: Time lapse photography is used to speed up the action in a town and a twenty storey building goes from ground level to completion in hour minutes. Visual speed is enhanced by a lively Bach piece preformed on a Moog synthesiser.

results.title: Quetico
results.creator_credit: Canadian Film Institute and Christopher Chapman
results.brief_description: Quetico Provincial Park in Ontario, an area of over a million acres of unspoiled wilderness, is being preserved as canoe country for present and future generations. The area is as wild and natural today as it was in the 17th century when explorer, trader and voyager passed through in search of furs and discovery.

results.title: Questions
results.creator_credit: Bruce Moir, Bob Kingsbury and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”.
The “God rich colony” is a huge industrial estate on the outskirts of Bombay. It is a self-contained company town where everything is provided for the factory workers and their families, including schools. An Australian director and a group of 15 year-old school children have a relaxed discussion about their concept of the Australian way of life and their lives in India.

results.title: Question. Communicate. Close
results.brief_description: Presented by Jo Hall, this video which takes a good Customer Service person and shows them how to be a great Sales Person. Different vignettes have been chosen to demonstrate the major points of a sales role. The focus is on the skills of questioning, communicating, recognising buying signals and closing the sale. In talking about these areas, this program highlights the difference between satisfying a customer enquiry and turning that enquiry into a sale. It is presented in a generic, rather than industry specific, fashion which gives the video broad appeal to a range of industries. Includes a Leaders guide, Participants workbook and Overhead transparencies.

results.title: Question of prejudice
results.brief_description: A study of the racist atitudes of some Australians toward migrant Australians, highligting the ‘wog’ syndrome. Investigtes the discrimination shown in the workforce towards groups such as the Lebanese, and its human effects such as the loss of self-esteem. Includes the views of Robert Cameron (White Australia Movement) and children.

results.title: Question in Togoland: A Pictorial report
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information
results.brief_description: The life, homes, school, occupations, religion, music and arts of the people of Togoland. The country, which has been under U.N. trusteeship, is prepared for a plebiscite. Each voter learns how to designate either union with the Gold Coast or continued trusteeship. As a result of the plebiscite Togoland joined the Gold Coast in the new nation of Ghana.

results.title: Quest for flight
results.creator_credit: Alan P. Sloan, Avator Learning and Robert Boucher
results.brief_description: Traces the history of aviation from the 15th Century when Leonardo da Vinci realised that flight was not an idle dream, through to air travel today. Traces the history of human’s attempts to imitate the bird from Icarus’ feathered wings to the Supersonic Transport system, focusing on Leonardo Da Vinci, Santos, Dumont, the Wright Brothers, and the significant technological advances made during World War I and III that have led to increased availability today. Also depicts renewed interest in simple forms of flight.

results.title: Quest for a better battery
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Researchers”.
Although petrol saving electric vehicles are making something of a comeback, they suffer from one major drawback, namely the poor performance of conventional lead acid batteries. Researchers at CSIRO’s Division of Mineral Chemistry are working to improve the performance of lead acid batteries made with nickel zinc or lithium plates.
